ebd98747-b891-4242-b3e5-4e42bf6e8e98.description: Textile Fundamentals is an introduction to the textile industry. Starting with fibers, the course provides an overview of textile processing through to finished fabrics.
ebd98747-b891-4242-b3e5-4e42bf6e8e98.name: Textile Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: This course is a total of about 17 hours of self paced online instructional videos with comprehension quizzes.

b8c0dfbb-6f4a-4837-ba02-3e9f097d8606.description: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt training will introduce you to the Lean Six Sigma philosophy and terminology and give you the tools you need to complete a Green Belt certification project. This course uses a combination of lectures, presentations and lab exercises to provide you with a strong foundation in Lean Six Sigma. You will gain the skills needed to lead Lean Six Sigma process improvement projects, work on teams led by Lean Six Sigma Black Belts and help your organization implement Lean Six Sig
b8c0dfbb-6f4a-4837-ba02-3e9f097d8606.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Training Certificate

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

586bc625-f519-4dab-9c06-684d302133d1.description: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt training is a four week course that will introduce you to the next level of the Lean Six Sigma philosophy. This course uses a combination of lectures, presentations and hands-on lab exercises to provide you with a strong foundation in Lean Six Sigma. The advanced statistics and topics will equip you to identify high-level opportunities for improvement within your company. You will effectively implement Lean Six Sigma Black Belt projects to achieve significant financial
586bc625-f519-4dab-9c06-684d302133d1.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt training is a four week course that will introduce you to the next level of the Lean Six Sigma philosophy. This course uses a combination of lectures, presentations and hands-on lab exercises to provide you with a strong foundation in Lean Six Sigma. 567649b8-7ea8-43bc-b9f1-e82320a75815.description: This course is a must for anyone working with dyed and finished fabrics. In this session, you will learn the basic concepts of textile wet processing which include preparation, dyeing, printing and finishing with emphasis on the interrelationships of fabric styles and wet processing steps. Specifically, you will focus on various processing sequences, details the causes and solutions to many common finished fabric problems, and the requirements for quality fabrics.
567649b8-7ea8-43bc-b9f1-e82320a75815.name: Dyeing and Finishing Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: This course is a must for anyone working with dyed and finished fabrics. In this session, you will learn the basic concepts of textile wet processing which include preparation, dyeing, printing and finishing with emphasis on the interrelationships of fabric styles and wet processing steps. Specifically, you will focus on various processing sequences, details the causes and solutions to many common finished fabric problems, and the requirements for quality fabrics.

af5ba2bc-d8ab-44b8-a340-3c04506ab390.description: Geared for professionals in sourcing, product development, fabric development, production, and merchandising of fabrics, Knit and Woven Fabric Design and Development reviews the mechanics of weft and warp knitting and weaving, details fiber and yarn selection, discusses fabric types for developing end-use products and examines the relationship between fabric design and fabric properties. This course enhances the learning process with comprehensive design and fabric analysis exercises.
af5ba2bc-d8ab-44b8-a340-3c04506ab390.name: Knit and Woven Fabric Design and Development

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

3258035b-2e1a-44fc-81dd-63e9fefc64fc.description: Master Black Belts are change agents who lead Lean Six Sigma projects at an enterprise level. Their efforts include deployment, training, coaching, mentoring, and providing technical support to Green Belts and Black Belts. NC State’s Master Black Belt (MBB) Certification Program provides a structured path for achieving your MBB certification with an emphasis on in-depth learning of statistics and leadership skills.
3258035b-2e1a-44fc-81dd-63e9fefc64fc.name: Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: MBB Certification Program topics: Advanced DOE and Advanced Control, Advanced Design of Experiments, Data Analysis using Advanced Experimental Designs, Advanced Control Charts, Design for Six Sigma and Simulations, DMADV Process.

skills.name: Define Measure Analyze Design And Validate (DMADV)

7b4b162e-a57d-44fb-af09-01243617e17f.description: The Chemical Finishing module is a review of techniques used to apply chemical finishes to textile products. The more frequently used chemical finishes for textiles are discussed as related to function and chemistry involved.
7b4b162e-a57d-44fb-af09-01243617e17f.name: Chemical Finishing

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

28153bb4-69f7-42d7-9958-1333c7ba94cc.description: The concept of circular economy is discussed in this module including moving toward closed loop manufacturing and steps in achieving this the circular economy modes. Examples of programs and products are also included.
28153bb4-69f7-42d7-9958-1333c7ba94cc.name: Circular Economy and Closed Loop Manufacturing in the GTC

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 13 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

b8c1ae83-a95a-47d9-b61e-314a348b330f.description: This module describes issues related to Climate Change and generations of GHG;s identify the major contributors throughout the GHG supply chain.
b8c1ae83-a95a-47d9-b61e-314a348b330f.name: Climate Change - GHG

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 8 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

1176745f-fbdd-4d50-b7b3-d437ef3bb8ce.description: The Color and Color Properties module covers information that will help you gain a better understanding of the variables that influence color perception. Current methods of shade matching and color measurement are presented. The relationship between perceived and acceptable color differences is discussed.
1176745f-fbdd-4d50-b7b3-d437ef3bb8ce.name: Color and Color Properties

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

feed90ae-a855-4836-9854-28038d5153fb.description: Much of the environmental impact of a product is determined by choices made by the designer and product developer. This module reviews 'sustainable design principles’ and identifies guidelines developed to promote the design/development of products that have a lower environmental impact.
feed90ae-a855-4836-9854-28038d5153fb.name: Designing for Sustainability

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 12 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

ee966188-033a-4f36-872c-73733758cf4e.description: The Dyeing and Dyestuffs module presents the objectives of dyeing and the keys to good quality dyeing. Dyestuff properties are discussed. Different types of dyeing equipment are reviewed along with advantages and disadvantages of each type. Methods of dyeing blends are also covered in this module.
ee966188-033a-4f36-872c-73733758cf4e.name: Dyeing and Dyestuff

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

8b5f98e2-7a2b-42a0-87b0-1871f0cbc310.description: A discussion of eco-labeling, characteristics of types I, II, and III, and those commonly used for textile and apparel related products
8b5f98e2-7a2b-42a0-87b0-1871f0cbc310.name: Ecolabels & Certifications

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 6 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

5f7072f8-bad6-4be5-be05-3701c0b8a198.description: This module identifies global concerns regarding water risk, stress and scarcity as it relates to waste use though the Global Textile Complex from fiber production to consumer use.
5f7072f8-bad6-4be5-be05-3701c0b8a198.name: Environmental - Water Use and Pollution

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 7 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

75405967-779f-4b59-ab6d-c5aa8cd97029.description: The Fabric Preparation module is an overview of major technical processes used on fiber, yarn, or fabric to prepare them for subsequent processes such as dyeing, finishing, printing, and other apparel and non-apparel processes. Chemical and mechanical processes are discussed as related to function and technical procedures.
75405967-779f-4b59-ab6d-c5aa8cd97029.name: Fabric Preparation

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

365bd719-69ed-428f-8f75-93c7c6abc736.description: The Fabric Printing module presents methods of textile printing and describes the equipment employed with each method. Advantages and disadvantages of each method are also explained. An overview of digital ink jet printing is given with the current systems available.
365bd719-69ed-428f-8f75-93c7c6abc736.name: Fabric Printing

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

1c135c43-fae9-41d9-afc4-83e5e74682ff.description: The Filament Yarns and Texturing module covers the vast scope of filament yarn types, classifications, and end uses. Special attention is paid to production steps and the various ways to texture filament yarns. Composite yarn types are discussed in addition to how the quality of filament yarns is evaluated. Finally, important fabric construction and design factors influencing the optimal use of certain types of filament yarns are addressed.
1c135c43-fae9-41d9-afc4-83e5e74682ff.name: Filament Yarns and Texturing

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

029b5692-279a-466a-aab6-e81c4d82ae8f.description: The supply chain in the global textile (GTC) complex is one of the most complicated. This unit identified specific sustainability concerns with various sectors and processes within the GTC supply chain.
029b5692-279a-466a-aab6-e81c4d82ae8f.name: Global Textile Complex (GTC) Supply Chain and Sustainability

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 2 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

1b73b63c-b095-4171-9afc-78f6f8f63174.description: In this hands-on course students will learn the mechanics and chemistry in preparation, dyeing and finishing. Samples from this exercise will be used for discussion, visual and physical evaluations.
1b73b63c-b095-4171-9afc-78f6f8f63174.name: Hands-On Technical Textiles: Dyeing and Finishing

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

e99a473c-7cca-4eb1-be02-3146b157ca63.description: This course introduces you to the design and programming of flat-knitted 3D technical textiles, an emergent technology with broad applications, to produce products for niche applications. Each of the four training days will focus on a different type of Shima Seiki machine. Receive intensive training of design structures from the selection of materials to the application technique, to prototype development. Educate yourself and/or your employees in a hands-on course covering an array of Shima Se
e99a473c-7cca-4eb1-be02-3146b157ca63.name: Hands-On Technical Textiles: Knit Design and Programming

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

c84e61d2-8e8a-41da-99e8-b19e58811e2f.description: This hands-on course benefits those who need to understand both the methodology and the interpretation of standard test procedures used in the textile industry. It is ideal for laboratory managers and technicians, as well as anyone who makes decisions based on textile product properties.
c84e61d2-8e8a-41da-99e8-b19e58811e2f.name: Hands-On Technical Textiles: Physical Testing

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

185a69de-d4da-47a8-8c87-bc57802aec14.description: This hands-on course covers short staple yarn manufacturing in the modern spinning facility at Wilson College of Textiles. Attendees will work on manually operating machines. This course will cover opening, carding, drawing, roving, and spinning. Course participants will complete the process of creating yarn from fiber.
185a69de-d4da-47a8-8c87-bc57802aec14.name: Hands-On Technical Textiles: Spinning

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

b10804a6-a3dd-4bd8-9eca-c84359e41e10.description: Through hands-on learning, this course teaches the beginning-to-end processes of weaving. Participants will cover sizing, warp prep, drawing in, slaying the reed, and tying in. They will assist in machine set-up and production of woven materials. This class includes tutorials on a variety of weaving machinery.
b10804a6-a3dd-4bd8-9eca-c84359e41e10.name: Hands-On Technical Textiles: Weaving

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

5bc7c50e-18fd-4b03-8d82-3707a7ee7fd2.description: This module emphasizes the complexity of both the GTC supply chain and sustainability emphasizing the importance of clearly identifying what characteristic of ‘sustainability’ you want to measure and then exploring common measurement tools used throughout the industry that are used.
5bc7c50e-18fd-4b03-8d82-3707a7ee7fd2.name: Material Evaluation & Tools

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 9 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

b91b1d00-f9d1-40d3-985c-452eb5f9913d.description: The Mechanical Finishing module is a review of techniques used to apply mechanical finishes to textile products. The more frequently used mechanical finishes for textiles are discussed as related to function and technology involved.
b91b1d00-f9d1-40d3-985c-452eb5f9913d.name: Mechanical Finishing

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

be2c89d7-fbd1-4bec-8c78-739da471418d.description: The Nonwoven Fundamentals module discusses the major web forming technologies with an overview of the processes involved. The technologies used for bonding with representative product types and advantages are explored.
be2c89d7-fbd1-4bec-8c78-739da471418d.name: Nonwoven Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

bd9debc3-29cb-4baf-b4b2-96af8df441e9.description: As demand for domestically produced PPE grows, many companies are pivoting productions lines and increasing capacity to manufacture cloth and nonwoven face masks and medical gowns. This course delves into materials, design, manufacture and testing of masks and gowns.
bd9debc3-29cb-4baf-b4b2-96af8df441e9.name: PPE: Materials, Design, Production and Testing

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: As demand for domestically produced PPE grows, many companies are pivoting productions lines and increasing capacity to manufacture cloth and nonwoven face masks and medical gowns. This course delves into materials, design, manufacture and testing of masks and gowns.

f2923b78-3498-4996-90fa-fc83a144a301.description: This module identifies production, consumption and disposal trends and options within the Global Textile Complex both during production and then after it is delivered to the consumer. Alternatives, including recycling, used in diverting waste from landfills and extending the useful life of products are discussed.
f2923b78-3498-4996-90fa-fc83a144a301.name: Pre & Post Consumer Waste Generation and Disposal

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 11 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

2781182b-ab8d-49a5-8218-ffbddbbfe055.description: This module discusses the importance of sustainability education at all sectors of the GTC, including consumers, to achieve effective and knowledgeable decision making throughout textile and apparel production, consumption and disposal.
2781182b-ab8d-49a5-8218-ffbddbbfe055.name: Printing and Marketing Claims of Sustainability

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 10 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

44b2dd2c-71b2-4712-a8fa-dddbb54ff503.description: This module identifies (Global Textile Complex (GTC) industry characteristics that have contributed to concerns that fall within the sustainability pillar of ‘Social’ or People and development of policies/procedures to address these. This includes information on issues of forced labor and slavery in the modern world.
44b2dd2c-71b2-4712-a8fa-dddbb54ff503.name: Social Sustainability: Forced Labor/Modern Slavery

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 4 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

5c845989-52e1-4729-a453-6d21591add58.description: This module identifies (Global Textile Complex (GTC) industry characteristics that have contributed to concerns that fall within the sustainability pillar of ‘Social’ or People and development of policies/procedures to address these. This includes information on specific, high profile cases and specific eco-labels that focus on this pillar.
5c845989-52e1-4729-a453-6d21591add58.name: Social Sustainability: Foundations & Issues in GTC

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 3 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

ee3119d3-40e6-40af-ba00-a508080f0441.description: This module reviews the various hazards commonly found throughout the Global Textile Complex. In addition to frequently reported fires and hazardous structures, other issues divided into sub categories of chemical, ergonomics, and psychosocial are introduced
ee3119d3-40e6-40af-ba00-a508080f0441.name: Social Sustainability: Working Conditions

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 5 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

1b75b224-e594-400d-816b-ae86bcd6aa49.description: The Spun Yarn Manufacturing module covers all the processing steps in the production of a short staple spun yarn, beginning with opening, cleaning, and blending and concluding with spinning and winding. The viewer will learn the key objectives of each process and gain knowledge of the many variables affecting yarn quality and production. All major types of short staple spun yarns are included along with their specific properties. Plied yarns and novelty yarns are also presented.
1b75b224-e594-400d-816b-ae86bcd6aa49.name: Spun Yarn Manufacturing

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

1ef780bf-32f8-484a-ba38-8fec52dbfb90.description: Sustainability is a complex topic receiving increasing attention through the textile and apparel supply chain – from raw material used to processing, to marketing, to end-of-life concerns. Course content includes key industry-related sustainability issues, measurement and reporting standards, certification programs, education, potential paths to reduce impacts, Life Cycle Assessment discussions, and future trends.
1ef780bf-32f8-484a-ba38-8fec52dbfb90.name: Sustainability in the Textile Industry

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: The course is three days in length with integrated lectures, case study reviews, and activities including situational scenarios and mapping of alternative options related to sustainability concerns.

f9850b04-64dc-404c-b74a-97d5f079b4dd.description: Learn basic concepts of lab dip formulation, shade matching, color measurement and evaluation. Topics covered include: lab dip techniques, dyestuff properties, basic wet processing steps, fundamentals of shade matching, instrumental color measurement and color evaluation methods.
f9850b04-64dc-404c-b74a-97d5f079b4dd.name: Textile Color Measurement Application

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Learn basic concepts of lab dip formulation, shade matching, color measurement and evaluation. Topics covered include: lab dip techniques, dyestuff properties, basic wet processing steps, fundamentals of shade matching, instrumental color measurement and color evaluation methods.

054f3826-14bc-441a-b336-7e3a75118c42.description: This module presents basic information and terminology related to fiber identification, classification, production, and properties. The module introduces the concept of polymerization and explains how the chemical composition and physical structure of a fiber influence its physical, chemical, and comfort properties. The student will learn the generic names for fiber classification as defined by the Federal Trade Commission and will be able to differentiate between natural and synthetic fibers.
054f3826-14bc-441a-b336-7e3a75118c42.name: Textile Fibers

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

61c33415-edeb-4911-be61-be2efe6b2dd6.description: The Warp Knitting module begins with some key information on warp beam formation and its relevance to the warp knitting machine. The key elements of tricot and raschel warp knitting machines will be presented along with the different types of fabrics that can be produced from these types of machines. Two bar fabrics, open-work fabrics, laying-in three and four bar fabrics, and two needle bar fabrics will be addressed.
61c33415-edeb-4911-be61-be2efe6b2dd6.name: Warp Knitting

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

832342ed-2296-4dc5-8124-4045904c17bb.description: The Weaving Fundamentals and Design module presents the basic motions of weaving, types of shedding, methods of filling insertion, woven fabric production calculations, and basic woven design. Derivatives of the basic weave designs are covered along with the different types of pile fabrics.
832342ed-2296-4dc5-8124-4045904c17bb.name: Weaving Fundamentals and Design

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

50bac5ea-bac0-42d2-bb62-89aeeac30547.description: The Weft Knitting module begins by introducing weft knitting and warp knitting and then proceeds to elaborate on weft knitting. Key machine elements are presented along with important knitting terms and definitions. Single knit machinery and fabrics, double knit machinery and fabrics, and flat-bed knitting are discussed. Different types of knit loops and their influence on the fabric properties are also covered.
50bac5ea-bac0-42d2-bb62-89aeeac30547.name: Weft Knitting

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

95ccb7c0-ea57-404c-91ef-82113125d38f.description: Introduction to susutainability today including a look at the historical development, the connection to the UN Sustainable Development Goals, and the the triple bottom line theory used in evaluation of company performance.
95ccb7c0-ea57-404c-91ef-82113125d38f.name: What is Sustainability

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Module 1 of Sustainability in the Textile Industry

ceebcad0-9767-4a91-9aae-e28e8dd85743.description: The Yarn and Warp Preparation module discusses the importance of warp preparation as it relates to efficiency and quality in weaving and warp knitting. The types and applications of warping and slashing equipment are discussed, and the important variables of each are highlighted.
ceebcad0-9767-4a91-9aae-e28e8dd85743.name: Yarn and Warp Preparation

issuer.summary: issued by NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension

entity.name: NC State University Zeis Textiles Extension
